item.title: Changeing home
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Armadylk, post:1, topic:262915”]i change home on the emote tab but i was told to go into player.java and change that cords too so when the players log in there at the home i edited this it was edge as home i switched the cords to same as top and bottom and when others log in its a black area help please

 // initial x and y coordinates of the player
    heightLevel = 0;
    // the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet
    teleportToX = 2524; // 3044;
    teleportToY = 2524; // 3044;[/quote]

lol? you have to keep both sides the same coords…

eg:

teleportToX = 2524; // 3044; teleportToY = 2524; // 3044;

to:

teleportToX = 2524; // 2524; teleportToY = 2524; // 2534;

the client your using might not support the area also.

if your wondering about your tabs, not teleing to home then search for the tab case.

it should look something like this:

NOTE: tab cases look different in other sources.

case 168: if (teleblock == true) { // Made by mod luke sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); } else { customCommand("home"); // made by mod luke } break;

that bascially means if you click on the first tab (case 168) it does the command home.

if your tab doesnt work then you obviously isnt teleing you to the correct place or in my case, you need to change your home command.

to make your tab say something its in texthandler.

Read full topic

item.title: Changeing home
item.dc:creator: @Destroyed_32 Destroyed 32
item.description:
@Destroyed_32 wrote:

demonnd:

idk i jus do client.java cases lol

I already helped him with TeamViewer… AND… in “client.java” you can just change where the “Home” Tab teles you and not where the start point is!

The Start-Point for new players on a server can be found in “Player.Java”… Just search for your coords where a new player starts and change it!

MfG

Read full topic
